comments:
Driver:  1021I 01:53

- Create a Dynamic Web project targetting Tomcat 5.0.  
- Create a Tomcat 5.0 server.
- Select the Dynamic Web project, right-click and select "Add/Remove project 
facet".  No menu item is displayed and I got the error:

I was using a brand new workspace with the 1021 01:53 I-build in a standalone 
environment (i.e. not self-hosting).  All I did was install the Tomcat 5.0 
server runtime, create a Dynamic Web project targetting Tomcat 5.0, then right-
click on the resulting Web project and select "Add/Remove Project Facets".  The 
Project Facet wizard did not show up and in the console stack trace, it shows 
an ExceptionInInitializerError caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: 
Could not find project facet web.  I did noticed though that there's an 
exception during Dynamic Web project creation as well.

Here's the console log:

bundle location: update@plugins/org.eclipse.wst.server.core_0.7.0.jar

I am completely at loss as to what you are seeing. I just ran the repro again 
on the I-build from Mon, 24 Oct 2005 -- 07:34 (+0300) and did not hit any 
problems. Here is what I did:

1. Downloaded an I-build and created an eclipse install.
2. Opened a new workspace.
3. In Workspace Preferences -> Server -> Installed Runtimes, defined a new 
Tomcat 5.0 runtime.
4. Created a new Dynamic Web Project, leaving all the defaults. This had the 
effect of selecting the tomcat runtime that I just created, but I don't think 
that actually has any effect.
5. Add/Remove Facets... comes up ok and I am able to bind to a runtime.

Does that look like the steps that you are following or are you doing something 
different? Does anyone else see this problem?

The "java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Could not find project facet web." 
does not sound like an intermittent or timing-related. The system is somehow 
finding a reference to a "web" facet, which doesn't exist since it has been 
renamed to "jst.web". 

The other errors that come up during project creation cannot cause this error.

Hi Konstantin, 

I tried downloading the 1020I 01:53 integration driver again into a clean image 
and started a new workspace, selecting "Add/Remove Project Facets" brings up 
the wizard and the appropriate runtime choices are shown.  I must have some 
older plugins when I was testing last.  I'm canceling the defect.

I tried the 1025I 06:48 driver on a fresh upzip and new workspace.  The problem 
with unable to bring up "Add/Remove project facets" is showing up again except 
this time it's complaining about:

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Could not find runtime component type 
org.eclipse.jst

Tim, could you take a look? It's complaining that it can't find runtime 
component type "org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.runtime.weblogic".

Konstantin,
This is a duplicate of a bug I opened against you yesterday. If there is a typo
or a missing id, the facet support dies. In this case it is failing because I
released part of the support for generic servers, but Gorkem was reviewing and
releasing the second half. Although I expect the support to not work until it is
all available (it is already going in this afternoon via another bug), facet
support needs to be hardened significantly so that a typo or a rogue plugin
cann't affect the entire framework.

Ok, it sounds like you are on top of the actual missing type id.

As far as robustness is corcerned, this is actually a separate issue that needs 
a different solution. The bridge makes calls like 
RuntimesManager.getRuntimeComplonentType( "..." ). Those calls throw an 
exception when the runtime component type id is not recognized. The bridge 
should guard against this situation by using the isRuntimeComponentTypeDefined 
method.

Sorry, I was still looking at the first stack trace. The code that contains the
new ids has been released, and the RuntimeBrdige in jst.server has been hardened
as well to avoid this.
Sounds like this has been fixed...
